info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 14 at 4:02PM EDT until August 14 at 7:15PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg VA
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Portions of central and west central Virginia, including the following counties, in central Virginia, Amherst. In west central Virginia, Rockbridge.
* WHEN...Until 715 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 402 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Buffalo River, Harris Creek, Brown Mountain Creek, Browns Creek, Falling Rock Creek, Buck Branch, Graham Creek, Cox Branch and Davis Mill Creek. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Forks Of Buffalo... Clifford... Pleasant View... Oronoco... Alto... Lowesville... Naola... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on X.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM EDT THIS EVENING
